intro: Corydalis zadoiensis, commonly known as the Zadoi corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often arranged alternately along the stem. Corydalis zadoiensis is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments, often found in alpine meadows and forested areas. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
